Submodules#

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.config module#

This module handles the configs

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.config.create_default_config() → Dict[str, Any][source]#

Creates a default token-classification config.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.config.parse_config_from_json(json_path: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]#

Parses config from a json file.

Also transforms config['device_name'] to torch.device(config['device_name']), raising an error if cuda[:#] is set but not available.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation module#

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation.evaluate_dataset(dataset: torch.utils.data.Dataset, model: transformers.PreTrainedModel, batch_size: int, ids_to_labels: Dict[int, str], rebuild_ner_labels: bool = True, do_debug: bool = False)[source]#

Evaluate an entire dataset using seqeval. Is used during the main train loop.

Parameters:

  • dataset – A dataset inheriting from torch.utils.data.Dataset, implementing at least __len__ and __getitem__(), where each item is a dict alike {{'model_input': tensor(), ...}} corresponding to a single example.

  • model – Self explanatory

  • batch_size – Self explanatory

  • ids_to_labels – A dict mapping the label numbers (int) used by the model to the original label names (str), e.g. {{0: "O", 1: "B-PERS", ...}}

  • rebuild_ner_labels – Whether to simulate NER Labels (for seqeval)

  • do_debug – Whether break loops after the first iteration.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation.evaluate_hipe(dataset: token_classification.data_preparation.HipeDataset, model: transformers.PreTrainedModel, device: torch.device, ids_to_labels: Dict[int, str], output_dir: str, labels_column: str, hipe_script_path: str, groundtruth_tsv_path: str = None, groundtruth_tsv_url: str = None, batch_size: int = 8, do_debug: bool = False)[source]#

Performs the entire pipeline to hipe-evaluate a model, i.e. : - Getting the model’s prediction on a dataset - Reconstructing a HIPE-compliant tsv with these prediction - Comparing the predictions-tsv and the corresponding groundtruth-tsv using the hipe scorer. - Writing the files.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation.evaluate_iob_files(output_dir: str, groundtruth_path: str, preds_path: str, method: str, hipe_script_path: str = None, output_suffix: str = None, task: str = 'nerc_coarse')[source]#

Evaluates CLEF-HIPE compliant files. If method is set to 'hipe', runs run CLEF-HIPE-evaluation within os.system. Else if method is set to 'seqeval, imports the files as dfs.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation.seqeval_evaluation(predictions: List[List[str]], groundtruth: List[List[str]], nerify_labels: bool = False)[source]#

Simple wrapper around seqeval.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.evaluation.seqeval_to_df(seqeval_output: Dict[str, Dict[str, float] | float], do_debug: bool = False) → pandas.DataFrame[source]#

Transforms seqeval_output to a MultiIndex pd.DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • seqeval_output –

    A dict containing:

    • A dict of metrics for each entity type

    • A pair {'overall_metric': value} for each overall metric.

    Looks like {'ent_type1': {'precision':float, 'recall':float}, ... , 'overall_recall':float,...}.

  • do_debug – Fills empty entity types with 0.

Returns:

A pd.DataFrame with a MultiIndex. The first level is the entity type, the second level is the metric.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.model module#

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.model.predict(model_inputs: Dict[str, torch.tensor], model: transformers.models)[source]#

Predicts for a batch or a single example.

Parameters:

model_inputs – A mapping to between the names of the model’s requirements and torch.Tensor of size (max_length, batch_size).

Example

{'input_ids': torch.tensor([[int, int, ...], [int, int, ...]]). model: A transformers.models.

Returns:

np.ndarray containing the predicted labels, so in the shape (number of exs, length of an ex).

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.model.predict_and_write_tsv(model, output_dir, tokenizer, ids_to_labels, labels_column: str, path: str | None = None, url: str | None = None)[source]#

Creates a dataset from a tsv, predicts and writes predictions to tsv.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.model.predict_batches(batches: torch.utils.data.dataloader.DataLoader | List[Dict[str, torch.tensor]], model: transformers.PreTrainedModel, do_debug: bool = False) → ndarray[source]#

Runs predict on a collection of batches.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.model.predict_dataset(dataset: torch.utils.data.Dataset, model: transformers.PreTrainedModel, do_debug: bool = False, batch_size: int = 8) → ndarray[source]#

Runs predict on a dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset – A dataset inheriting from torch.utils.data.Dataset, implementing at least __len__ and __getitem__(), where each item is a dict alike {{'model_input': tensor(), ...}} corresponding to a single example.

  • model – A transformers.models.

  • do_debug – Whether break loops after the first iteration.

  • batch_size – Self explanatory.

Returns:

np.ndarray containing the predicted labels, so in the shape (number of exs, length of an ex).

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.pipeline module#

This module is highly inspired by HuggingFace’s run_ner.py. It runs on a single GPU.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.pipeline.create_dirs(config: Dict[str, Any])[source]#
ajmc.nlp.token_classification.pipeline.main(config: str | Dict[str, Any])[source]#

Main entrypoint.

Parameters:

config – The config-dict or the path to a config[‘json’].

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.pipeline.set_seed(seed)[source]#

Sets seed for random, np.random and torch.

ajmc.nlp.token_classification.pipeline.train(config: Dict[str, Any], model: transformers.PreTrainedModel, train_dataset: token_classification.data_preparation.HipeDataset, eval_dataset: token_classification.data_preparation.HipeDataset, tokenizer: transformers.PreTrainedTokenizer)[source]#

Main training function.

This function does the following:

  • Does the training on train_dataset

  • At the end of each epoch:

    • evaluate the model on eval_dataset using seqeval

    • saves a model checkpoint

    • saves the model as best_model if model has highest scores

Parameters:

  • config – An argparse.Namespace containing the required transformers.TrainingArguments

  • model – A transformers model instance

  • train_dataset – The torch.utils.data.Dataset on which to train

  • eval_dataset – The torch.utils.data.Dataset on which to evaluate the model

  • tokenizer – The model’s tokenizer.
